intro: Primula plebeia, commonly known as the common primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, white, or pink. The plant features a basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and meadows. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
